intro: Phiambolia unca, commonly known as the slender phiambolia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and small, elliptical leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Phiambolia unca is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
